Fields.DialogueText: Ladies and gentlemen, we have vermin to dispatch!
@BATTLE
Thank you for the good work out there, Missy.
No need to thank me. I was simply fulfilling my duty to the country I love.
The Founding Fathers would be proud.
Well, I would hope so, given their connection to my birthplace.
Down in Mississippi?
Oh, no, I meant where I was constructed – in Virginia.
Fair enough.
That's why I feel a special connection. I want to make them proud of me, and uphold their legacy.

Fields.MenuText: Heh. Even your home away from home is Southern.
Which Founding Father is your favorite?
You know I'm pretty much obligated to ask if you know any good Virginia recipes.

Fields.DialogueText: As sure as butter on biscuits, and proud of it!
I would have to say Mr. George Washington – a true champion of freedom and justice for all.
Darling, of course I do. Perhaps I can whip something up for you in the future.
Anyways, back to the main point: I intend to never let my nation down.
You won't. We have a long way to go, but every step we take brings new hope for all the nations.
My gosh. So poetic!
If you're good.
... Or impressively bad.
I think you'll find I can manage both.
Brrr!
Are you okay, Missy?
I'm... hanging in there. This cold wind has got to die down at some point, right?
Yeah, but until then, you need to stay warm.
Maybe I'll just... take a nap for a little bit. Be a dear and wake me up when the temperature improves, please?
Missy, it's not a good idea to sleep out in weather like this.
But the weather is so darn wearisome... The cold does not suit me at all.

Fields.MenuText: Want to do some exercises together? Just you and me.
Here. This blanket will help you warm up.
Maybe I can help you cook up something hot.

Fields.DialogueText: We could exercise... or maybe we could find something else to do to keep warm?
Thanks, Captain. You're a sweetheart. Maybe we can both fit under this blanket? I wouldn't mind being close to you...
That would be good. I'm not an expert on making foods to warm up from the chill, so any help will be much appreciated.
It doesn't seem so cold now. Maybe the weather's warming up a bit. Not as nice as a southern summer, but tolerable enough.
Not as tolerable as you would think – Morganas in sight dead ahead!
*sigh* When I wished for things to heat up, this was not what I had in mind.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I don't mind either.
Oh, my goodness gracious...
Missy, what's wrong?
The cotton I was growing... the frost killed it.
You were growing cotton? Why? Were you trying to use it for clothing?
Partially, but I also just wanted to see it bloom. Now that will never happen, I'm afraid.
Missy, are you okay?
I... just feel bad that I brought it out here. It was my responsibility, but I failed to protect it.

Fields.MenuText: Hey, it got to breathe the ocean air. That's something, right?
You did your best. That's all you can do.
We all struggle to blossom in this world. We just have to accept setbacks and move on.

Fields.DialogueText: Interesting perspective, Captain. I suppose it did get to experience more of the world than it normally would have.
Thanks. But... I want to do better.
You're right. The Lord has his own reasons for the way the world works, so we have to trust in Him and move forward.
Why don't we give your, uh, friend a burial at sea.
Yes, let's pay our respects. Oh, Heavenly Father, thank you for the gift of this plant while it was still living. Amen.
I'm very suddenly aware that it's tough to bury something at sea... when it floats.
It will sink in time – even sooner, with those Morganas stirring up the current.
@BATTLE
You will. I believe in you.
Oof! Now, how does this work?
What's with the broom? Working on more of your cleaning?
Not really. I'm practicing a new game – well, I mean a game I haven't played before. It's called stickball.
Having some trouble with it?
It is kind of like baseball, but I'm trying to do it the traditional style. It's harder than I thought, though.

Fields.MenuText: Keep at it. You'll get it soon enough.
It's not the end of the world if you don't master it. As long as you're having fun.
Maybe you should just take a break to loosen your nerves a bit.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks! I've almost got the hang of it!
Yes, but it's one of the oldest sports going back home. My honor will not allow me to back down on this!
You might be right. I could use some rest to clear my head.
Hey, look at how far I hit that one! I think I've got it now!
Nice shot, Missy. Listen, I've got to get to the bridge now - but if you want to play against a challenger sometime, I'm game.
Oh, you know it. We'll need to organize a full team, though. Maybe get more equipment. It'll-
Hang on. Before you run off with a sign-up sheet for the crew, let's deal with these Morganas first.
Right! Hey, maybe I'll get some stickball practice during the combat... I'd like to slap them to the other side of the ocean!
@BATTLE
... You're not actually going to rest, are you?
You really do get me.
Whoa, what's that you're throwing around?
A boomerang.
Right. Boomerang.
My talents are plentiful, Captain. It's all in the wrist.
Where did it come from? It doesn't exactly scream "Gulfport" to me.
I got one as a souvenir when I did a goodwill tour to Australia back in the day. It took a while, but I've got the hang of it now.
Planning on making it a talent act for your show?
Hm... I'm not sure. It's neat, but it's not exactly Southern style.

Fields.MenuText: Technically, Australia is way south, so it still counts, right?
I just thought it would be an act you'd enjoy performing.
Can't a showboat touring the world have acts from all over?

Fields.DialogueText: That's one way to look at it.
I suppose it might be fun... and something unusual to see.
Why, sure... I never thought of it like that.
Okay, I'll give it a shot!
Excellent.
But later - right now we'd better get to our stations.
@BATTLE
I'm not going to lie - if anybody else on this ship was playing with one of those I'd impound it to prevent loss of life.
You seem to make it work, though.
... I know that look.
You know what look?
I know the look of a certain captain who wants to play with a new toy but can't work up the gumption to ask.
Well, I did just say that I'd take it away from any other crewmember for fear of accidental homicide. That would be a bad look for a captain, too.
Pf. I'd be thrilled to give you lessons, honey.
Choo, choo!
Playing with a train set? Those are always pretty interesting to build.
I know, right? They're absolutely fascinating.
Funny, I've always seen you more as an enthusiast of water transports.
I love cars and trains... though I do pity that they can only cross rivers and the like where there's a bridge.
You can't make a railway across an entire ocean.
Actually, now that you mention it...
Oh, no... I've planted a seed... and not a cottonseed one.
I was saying maybe I should look into starting a railroad that travels the seven seas.

Fields.MenuText: What got you so interested in railroads to begin with?
All the tracks would fence in ship traffic, though.
If you wanted the railroad to be stable, wouldn't you have to build on the bottom of the sea?

Fields.DialogueText: Do you want me to tell you the entire history of the Mississippi Central Railroad? `Cause I can.
Good point. But that just means I'll have to think harder on this.
Not a bad idea, Captain! That would keep the surface free for ships, and passengers could gaze at the ocean's hidden wonders!
Some people say the old-fashioned ways of getting about are on their last legs. I want to prove them wrong.
In this day and age, anything is possible. You're living proof.
Oh, now you're getting sweet on me? Well, then - I forgive you for your cottonseed comment. You're welcome.
I'm going to require more forgiveness, because it looks like we've got more rotten-seeds to kill.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hey, now! Before I was so rudely interrupted...
... I would deplore the punning, but that was actually pretty good.
Ah... ah... ACHOO!
Bless you, Missy.
Thank you! Just feeling a little under the weather today.
Wait, seriously? Are you okay? We can get the doctor to-
No, no, no! I do declare I am as healthy as a mockingbird. *cough*
I believe you implicitly. But go get some rest.
Don't... mind if I d-dooo... *faints*
Whoa, Missy! I've got you!

Fields.MenuText: I'm ordering you to take some bed rest, and I'll carry you there myself if I have to.
Take it easy. I'm here for you.
Hang in there. You're strong, you can get through this.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, how gallant! And are you winking at me? If I wasn't swooning before, I am now...
Well, that's... I... gosh, you have strong arms.
I... oh, shoot! Approaching Morganas, Captain. We'd better get to our battle stations!
No. Rest for you.
No need! I'm cured! Poof, Belle magic!
Was that an act to get my attention, then? You could just flirt with me instead of collapsing, you know.
Awww... Don't ruin all of the fun, Captain.
@BATTLE
And you're blushing a little, too...
I'll be fine! It was just a passing little spell.
... Wait.
Smooth sailing today?
Yes, everything is just peachy. No sign of a Morgana yet, but it's only a matter of time.
Hey, don't jinx us.
Let them come. I want to be out here giving it my all.
Why are you so eager to fight them?
I don't ever want to be left out again. This is my chance to serve, and I want to make the most of it.
What do you mean?
I was going to help our troops and sailors in the first World War, and I was ready to show everyone my elegance and power... but then the war ended before I could do anything.
And that's why you're so eager to fight this time around?
Yes. I failed to make a difference before, and every moment that I am not fighting is one that someone else has to make up for my absence.

Fields.MenuText: You're part of the campaign now. That's all that matters.
Being properly ready for battle is important, too, and that requires intermittent rest.
Feeling guilty over things outside your control is a waste of time.

Fields.DialogueText: I just wish I could make a bigger impact.
I know, I just get impatient.
I suppose you're right. I have to trust that the Lord will guide me down a righteous path for us all.
Be patient. Eventually, that alarm is going to go off again, and-
Congratulations! You got your wish and so did I!
Then let's get cracking, Missy. To battle stations.
@BATTLE
You already have.
*ALARM*
The Morganas better give their hearts to the Lord, because their backsides are mine!
Captain, look at this! Aren't those waves amazing? If I could find or make a surfboard, maybe I could...
Surfing? Really?
Yep! It was a popular sport when I was touring Hawaii and Australia, so I thought I might give it a shot if the waves ever looked right.
And do they look right?
Intimidating, actually... but I have yet to surrender! I'm going to find a good piece of sheet metal or some wooden planks. Maybe the machine shop can make a surfboard for me.
Priorities, Missy.
Still... this one might be kind of tough. Any advice?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe it has something to do with flowing alongside the currents, kind of like a river.
Maybe you could pretend you're balancing on a log.
As long as you know how to swim going in, you'll figure out the rest in the end.

Fields.DialogueText: I see. I think I can work with that.
Interesting. It would make a useful exercise, in any case.
Thanks! I know I will.
I had better skedaddle to the machine shop. Maybe they can make me a board before the big waves get away from us.
I think I see the source of the waves. Check the horizon, Missy. Wake from Morganas?
Confirmed. *sigh*
@BATTLE
Having said that, I do love how adventurous you can be. All these hobbies...
Well, clearly, they pay off for me.
The Morganas have been operating in some odd patterns. Do they seem spread out to you?
They're all over the place, but maybe it's not random. It might be for a reason... to avoid something maybe. I'd suspect they've laid mines beneath the surface in this region.
That's a depressingly good guess.
Still, I'm sure we can handle them. What is your command?

Fields.MenuText: Navigate us with extreme care.
Weave swiftly through their formations. I trust you can get past them smoothly.
Concentrate your firepower on clearing a path.

Fields.DialogueText: I know what you mean, a tiny snag can rip a ship apart at the seams. I'll get us through safely.
Got it. It's just like dancing through a debris field on the old river!
Will do. They don't stand a chance.
Engines all ahead full, Captain!
Right here with you, all the way.
To battle! For the flag and the glory!
@BATTLE
Something smells bad enough to gag a maggot out there.
@BATTLE
Nice work defeating the Morganas again, Missy.
Just give me a sweet second. I'm still getting this piece of debris from the Morganas.
What are you using it for? Scientific research? Trying to figure out why they regenerate?
No, I'm just trying to collect some artifacts for historical purposes.
Really? I never knew you were a historian.
Not exactly, but Newport - my old stomping grounds in Virginia - has a museum dedicated to maritime history.
Ah. And you want to ensure they have records for the present conflict?
Yes. And not just records. I want future generations to be able to imagine what it felt like.

Fields.MenuText: They might be interested to hear your personal narratives as well. You Belles have really fascinating stories to tell.
I'm sure that the museum will appreciate your donations.
Make sure you keep track of the histories behind each item. That's important when you place them in a museum.

Fields.DialogueText: You really think so? That would be divine!
I want to make them all proud of what we're doing out here.
I'll keep that in mind as I do inventory.
Well, if there's anything I can do, I'm eager to-
You are? Oh, bless your heart! Could you use those big strong muscles to carry a few teensy boxes to the storage area for your sweet Belle?
Oof! I think I spoke too soon.
Don't fret, Captain. I'll make it up to you soon, I promise! *blows kiss*
As soon as you're ready, though, we ought to scout the area for potential reinforcements. I don't think these guys were supposed to be alone out here.
At least some of it, anyway.
Ugh. How is this ever going to work?
What's bothering you, Mississippi?
Well, I started talking with other ships to get their own acts going for the show, but I'm not sure about their ideas.
What's wrong with them?
Oh, nothing – they're quite interesting – it's just that I'm not sure if they are of the right... quality.
Right quality?
Idaho wants to do a ski stunt! How is that even related to a showboat act?!
I see. It sounds like everyone has their own ideas.
I'm tickled that they're excited, but I just don't know if they really appreciate the art form of showboat performances.

Fields.MenuText: If I recall, showboats had their own rough beginnings on the Mississippi.
Maybe they just want to keep their own practices alive, just as you are.
So it won't quite be the usual sort of show. Maybe the variety will make things interesting?

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. With the steamboats' rugged history, I suppose the acts aren't all that crude in comparison.
From that perspective, I do understand.
Yeah, it's the fun that's most important in any show.
I suppose I'll try to stay more open-minded about potential acts for the show.
Great. It's going to be interesting seeing how everything works out.
I just hope that the Morganas don't cause a last-minute cancellation.
Yeah, they seem to always come when they're least wanted.
@BATTLE
Oh, my sweet Captain, please be more careful about what you say!
What are you trying to make with that clay?
Oh, I'm just working on some pottery. This right here is gonna be something special!
Every time I turn around, you've got a new hobby. What made you decide to work on this?
I just thought I might try to take up after the ''Mad Potter of Biloxi.''
''Mad Potter?" That's an interesting title.
An eccentric style, to be sure, but an amazing one, at that. Here's a picture of one of his works.
Sort of lumpy, and strange... but the more I look at it...
I can tell you adore it. I thought I would give it a shot, and make something special for you, but...
Don't feel discouraged. Your stuff is going to turn out great.
Thank you for the words of encouragement.

Fields.MenuText: I imagine there's plenty of fresh clay along the Mississippi.
What are you trying to make here? I don't mean to be rude, but I'm not sure what I'm looking at, exactly.
You bring your own style into the art.

Fields.DialogueText: There definitely is. Hmm.... maybe this would work better if I used some fresh mud and sand from the different places we go.
Ha! I haven't gotten that far. Maybe a flower vase?
It shows? Thank you, that makes me feel really good.
I think this one's done. Surely you've got a minute to wait with little ol' me until it dries? Oh, you wouldn't mind holding my hand if it's got a little clay on it, would you?
As long as your lips don't have clay on them.
Oh, you rascal! Trying to make me blush!
You'll have to wait on that. Looks like we have incoming Morgana forces!
@BATTLE
Working with clay is fun, but I do wish the process was a little tidier. I'll need to spend hours wiping the mud off my dress.
Forward for glory!
@BATTLE
I need damage reports and an update on the crew's status, Missy.
We're all right... but oh! What happened to your shirt?
Oh, I see. It just got ripped a little during the fray. Nothing of consequence.
Nevertheless, leave it alone and the tear will simply get worse and worse as it unravels.
That look on your face tells me you have an idea.
I can sew it up for you in no time.
Really?
I pride myself on my embroidery. I promise to make your garment better than it ever was before.

Fields.MenuText: Thanks, but I can sew it myself.
Was your own outfit damaged? I know that you might need to take care of your clothes first.
Thank you. I appreciate the help.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, you know how to sew as well? Still, I would like to do this for you.
One should always help others first. I can wait a little to deal with my own setbacks.
You're welcome. What are friends for?
Well, then? What are you waiting for? Give me that shirt!
Hey! You didn't need to pull it right off! And right in front of the crew!
Just taking it back to my quarters for a refitting. Chase me if you want, but I must be going! *wink*
Mississippi!
Just friends?
Just an expression, my lovely Captain.
... Lucky I had an undershirt on.
Captain, I finished stitching up your uniform.
Thanks, I really appreciate it.
Well, what are you waiting for? It's just us in your cabin, so try it on and let me see how it fits you. I want to admire my handiwork... and the Lord's. *wink*
All right, all right. Okay, it's on.
Beautiful. What do you think of it?

Fields.MenuText: I notice you made a few custom designs on it.
It feels really soft and comfy.
It's perfect.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, I just thought they would improve the whole look. And the designs ensure you'll have a little piece of me right near your heart.
That's the southern style of friendliness, sewn right into the fabrics.
Captain, you're making me blush!
I sense another background story about your sewing hobby.
I really enjoy the art of sewing. And the philosophy behind it.
The philosophy? I can understand the art angle, but philosophy?
Yes. It's very much the same nature as piloting a boat down the Mississippi. You have to get things just right, or you'll prick yourself on something.
And yet, that thrill of narrowly avoiding the traps makes me feel alive, just as I do on the battlefield.
I think I understand what you mean. In that case, let's make this next battle a masterpiece.
It's certain to be with you as my muse!
@BATTLE
I like that - even if it isn't exactly per the uniform regulations.
"Oh, Susanna, don't you cry for me!"
You know, Mississippi, now might not be the best time for singing.
I suppose you're right – all this noise from the battle is drowning out my lovely voice.
That's not what I meant, but fair enough. How are your systems working?
Everything is running like logs down the river. A little damage, but nothing I can't shine up once we're through here.

Fields.MenuText: It's good to see your confidence is still there. That's something I love about you.
Sometimes, I really envy how you can act so refined in the middle of trouble like this.
Good job. We're going to get through this.

Fields.DialogueText: Even if I worry now and then, I am a proud lady and protector on the water, and if anything, I know that you'll be there for me.
Oh, dear Captain. You have some southern fire in you as well. It is together that we do the Lord's work. Morgana witches will never understand that sort of bond.
I have never doubted that. God willing, I know that one day this will all be over, and we can relax once more.
The battle isn't done just yet. A little more pounding, and we'll have those Morganas beat.
Don't worry. I have some right in my sights...
@BATTLE
Ah, Captain, care to join me for a little jog? It is such a lovely day out here.
Given that the heat and sun are unbearable today, I would beg to differ.
Oh, this kind of weather is nothing. Down south, we would consider a day like this to be a tad chilly.
I'd say something sarcastic, but I'm too hot to care.
Are you feeling okay, Captain? If there's anything I can do for you, I would be more than happy to assist.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry about me. You sound like you're having fun, at least.
Do you know any good ways to cool off?
Mind if I borrow your parasol for a bit?

Fields.DialogueText: You shouldn't be so flippant about this. Overheating is a serious matter. And in any case, you're precious to me. It's only natural that I worry about you.
Well, we could take a short swim around the ship. Actually, that would be a fine form of recreational fitness.
Of course. Here, it should take the burden of the heat away.
Well, I feel a cold wind coming in, so that's good.
No, it's bad...
The origin of that wind... I recognize that chill, the dark aura whenever one of those ghosts pays a visit.
@BATTLE
Okay... Maybe I shouldn't have asked.
Thanks for sharing.
Don't mention it, darling.
*ALARM*
Huff! This is a lot of work.
Mississippi, what are you doing?
Captain! Exceptional timing! Could you please help me move this pecan tree?
Sure. Heave...ho!
There. That should do it. Thank you kindly.
No problem. And it's not like you really needed the help.
A pecan tree, huh?
This is just one of many. And why not? They're quite pretty, aren't they?

Fields.MenuText: What are your intentions?
I'm not sure this will be the right climate for them.
Did you have to purchase so many of them, though?

Fields.DialogueText: I was thinking about making some classic dishes like pecan pie and fried peach ice cream.
I know, but with enough love and care they'll survive. I've gotten used to life out here, after all.
Well, we have a large deck, and I wanted to recreate a forest out here. I love the ocean, but it seem so empty on the surface sometimes.
If you can manage the leaf debris and keep them out of the way, I suppose there is room for a little grove.
Thank you, thank you, Captain! You are sweet as a peach.
@BATTLE
Your intentions have certainly got my attention now.
*ALARM*
Aw, but I do like to see you flex.
Heh.
Fishing again?
Yes. This time, I am positively determined to bring in some catfish to grill!
Given where we are at sea, that might be challenging.
Has anything bitten?
Truth be told, it's been slow as molasses, but I remain hopeful.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't it kind of dull just sitting around and waiting?
Well, I hope you catch something. Good luck.
Mind if I give it a go?

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all. It is kind of nice to just sit back, gaze upon the water, and enjoy the peace.
Thank you. Once I succeed, I'll make my secret recipe for you with the catch of the day.
Sure. Here, let me show you how it's done.
Sometimes what matters most is just enjoying life for what it is. Anyways, I doubted from the start that we would find anything today.
Those accursed Morganas stir up the currents and scare all the fish away. I need to remind them soon of my might and hope that sense finally blesses them.
Speak of the devil, look at the horizon over there.
@BATTLE
Well, I hope you don't mind then if I enjoy the wait here with you as well.
A peaceful moment is sometimes just that. A moment. Ah, well. Morganas, kiss my Southern sass!
Whoa, just listen to that wind howl. It's quite a storm out there.
It certainly is blowin' up! Well, at least we are nice and snug inside. Care for some tea?
Thanks, but shouldn't you be keeping watch outside?
And get my clothes all soaked? I'll just keep you company in here.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you already getting wet, given that you're the ship?
Missy, it's really important that we stay alert. I can watch out there with you, if you'd like.
I won't say no to a little time together. What do you want to do?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, but at least I can maintain a visage of respectability like this.
Oh, all right. No rest for soldiers and heroines, is there?
Nothing too much. Just sit down, enjoy some drink and fine company, and a little chit chat.
The storm seems to be getting worse.  I can hear some more thunder.
That's not thunder.
Then, no choice but to head into the storm.
Yes. They will face a worse storm from my artillery.
@BATTLE
We'll whip them into next week! Let's go!
@BATTLE
Well, that's that.
Yep. Say, Missy, do you want to practice for the show? I want you to see what I've come up with.
I'm more than happy to watch you perform, but I'm not sure about my own act.
What's wrong? I thought you had something really great in mind.
Well, I can still manage the showboat and the acts, but I'm not so sure about getting up on the stage.
Why? You're a natural at this. It's not like you have stage fright.
Actually...
Oh.
I may have overrepresented my stage experience. I really want to do a good performance, but whenever I think of doing it in front of everyone... Oh! I get all flustered.

Fields.MenuText: You're a strong lady, Mississippi. I know you won't back down when the time comes.
Just try to be yourself.
Hey, we're your friends. No matter what happens, we won't laugh, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: You know you're right. I won't back down when it comes to Morganas, so why start with this?
You're right. I cannot let myself get mired with doubt.
Unless it's supposed to be funny, right?
As a matter of fact, why don't you try it out now? You can start with an audience of one and move up from there.
That is less intimidating! Well, here I go...
Of course.
We have a deal, then.
La de da da de da dum, da doo...
You seem cheerful, humming away. What's new?
I harvested some peaches for some old-fashioned ice cream. It's put me in a sunny mood.
Want to try a scoop?
Don't mind if I do!
So? How does it taste?

Fields.MenuText: Sorry, I got a brain freeze.
I guess you CAN like cold things.
This is great!

Fields.DialogueText: Heavens to Betsy, Captain! I'm surprised you took such a big bite... surely the brain freeze was inevitable at that point.
Best way to manage with the heat. I just dislike the extreme end of the temperature.
Music to my ears! Oh, I could just kiss you right now!
I don't know if I've ever had ice cream this good before, honestly.
Old-fashioned and sweet like me. Hopefully I can keep the tradition alive.
I have no doubt of that. All we need now is an ice cream jingle.
Well, there is some unfortunate background noise coming our way. *sigh*
@BATTLE
Mississippi, what are you doing indoors? Want to go on a run?
Thank you for the invitation, but I must decline. I think I will just stay inside today.
Why? It's a beautiful, sunny day today.
Precisely, my dear Captain.
What do you mean?
I am just worried that the sun will scorch my skin. We're out of my favorite lotion, you see.
But you want to go outside. I can tell.
I do. I just don't...

Fields.MenuText: Well, you could always use nature's homemade remedy. Mud.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain! That sort of thing... but then again, it is the nature of the old river. Maybe if I could clean up afterwards...
All right. All right, here I go... I'm still a little nervous. What if my skin gets... tanned?
If it helps, I wouldn't mind.
Sincerely?
You're beautiful, pale or tan. The most important part is that lovely, graceful smile of yours. And that will never change.
Captain, you sure make a Belle feel special - you charmer!
*ALARM*
Come on, we have work to do.
Let me delay you for just a second... *smooch* There! Now I'm ready for anything!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You have your parasol, right? That will protect you.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, but it wouldn't work well running.
Maybe if you practiced, you could make it into an act.
Captain, I fear that perhaps you need less time in the sun?

Fields.MenuText: How about just for a little bit? A little sun is good for the skin and body.

Fields.DialogueText: Only if you spend some time with me inside after that? Just the two of us? If that's settled, then I'll join you for a little jog.
It was a joke.
Morganas ahead.
Captain, we're ready for them. Everything is ready to go.
Good. Are we going to be able to break past them?
Not to fear. My cannons will pound them to bits.
Glad to hear that enthusiasm, Missy.
Any last-minute commands before they're in range?

Fields.MenuText: We've done all we could. Now we simply need to wait for things to begin.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. Sometimes, we just have to be satisfied with ourselves and trust in the Lord.
Standby to open fire once contacts are in range.
Ready and willing! These fools don't stand a chance of defeating us. It's like they've got two gallons of crazy in a one gallon bucket, trying to go up against Mighty Miss!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Just be ready to shoot.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, I'll be off like a rocket when it's time.

Fields.MenuText: Make sure that all of the stoves are turned off. Safety first.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Good call, Captain. But don't worry, I already checked with the cooks. We're got pie to look forward to after this fight.
It sure is nice to just gaze out at the water, isn't it?
It certainly is. It seems so boundless with possibilities.
Yes, life is so full of choices. Which one to make here? Or what about that one over there?
What was that?
Captain, you have the good sense to know that I'm a complex woman.
Yes, you certainly are. I like that part of you.
This Mississippi Belle likes to be carefree with her love, like the sea. But sometimes, you find someone you care about at a deeper level, you know?
And?
We've been through a lot together so, if I may ask...
Could we please go on a date?
That was MY line!
And you're MY lady.
There you go making me blush again! But still... proper courtship is of the utmost importance. Not just flirting here and there, but a proper process... It will be fun.
All right. I'm waiting.
...Captain, would you please grace me with the honor of...
*ALARM*
Dang! Trouble at our doorstep! Do they have no decency?!
For our first real date, why don't we do our usual pastime?
You mean sink Morganas? It's not traditional courtship, but it'll work. Can't be worse than meeting the in-laws.
@BATTLE
You mean the Morganas, right? With gunfire, I hope?
Yes and yes, for now. *kiss*
*giggles* Now don't be afraid. Come, darling. Be sure we introduce ourselves properly.
Wait... in-laws?
